text:
Three students from Kerala were killed on Saturday when the car they were travelling in collided with another vehicle in the UAE’s Sharjah city.

The incident took place on Al Dhaid-Al Madam Road in Sharjah in the wee hours of Saturday.

Ashmid Ashraf, Muhammad Shifam and Mohammad Shounoub were returning to Dubai after a short holiday when they met with the accident, Gulf News reported. The three students were killed on the spot.

Colonel Haran Mubark Al Jazai, acting police director of Eastern Region, said the vehicle carrying the students caused the accident. He said the vehicle entered the road from a prohibited area and collided with another vehicle that was travelling on its path.

The driver of the other vehicle involved in the accident was injured and admitted to a nearby hospital.

Ashraf from Kozhikode and Shifam from Kannur were studying at Middlesex University in Dubai. Shounoub was also from Kozhikode, the report said.

The Kerala Muslim Cultural Community is making efforts to get the bodies released for repatriation to Kerala, it said. — PTI
title: 3 students from Kerala killed in Sharjah accident
